snippet: Recent quakes in Youngstown, Ohio, were the 10th and 11th to occur near a 9,200-foot-deep disposal well used in the hydraulic fracturing process.
abstract: Recent quakes in Youngstown, Ohio, were the 10th and 11th to occur near a 9,200-foot-deep disposal well used in the hydraulic fracturing process.
lead_paragraph: A 4.0 magnitude earthquake that struck Youngstown on Saturday occurred at a site that was almost identical to one hit a week earlier, a seismologist says -- close to the bottom of a 9,200-foot-deep disposal well where liquid waste from natural-gas wells had been injected under pressure. The finding provides further evidence that the waste from the fracking process may have migrated from the well into deeper rock formations. [The New York Times]

headline.main: On Our Radar: Quakes and Fracking
